sub_topic: Probability of a certain outcome in a sports game
message_1: In a basketball game, a player makes 70% of their free throws. If they have to take 10 free throws during the game, what is the probability that they will make all 10 of them?
message_2:
To find the probability of making all 10 free throws, we need to multiply the probability of making each individual free throw together. Since the player makes 70% of their free throws, the probability of making each free throw is 0.7.

So, the probability of making all 10 free throws is:

0.7 * 0.7 * 0.7 * 0.7 * 0.7 * 0.7 * 0.7 * 0.7 * 0.7 * 0.7 = 0.7^10 â‰ˆ 0.0282475

The probability of making all 10 free throws is approximately 2.82%.
